definition: wind direction/the way the wind blows/fig. trend/direction of events/how things develop (esp. how they affect oneself)/public opinion (concerning one's actions)/publicity (usually derog.)/limelight
wind/news/style/custom/manner/CL:陣|阵[zhen4],絲|丝[si1]
head/hair style/the top/end/beginning or end/a stub/remnant/chief/boss/side/aspect/first/leading/classifier for pigs or livestock/CL:個|个[ge4]
suffix for nouns
to push oneself forward/to seek fame/to be in the limelight/same as 出鋒頭|出锋头[chu1 feng1 tou5]
to steal the show/to grab the limelight
to lie low (until the fuss dies down)

sentences.english: Now, Bert, quit hogging the limelight.
Don't be pushy, but let everybody know you're around.
sentences.chinese: 別好出風頭，但是要讓大家知道你的存在。

sentences.english: The new girl is such a flirt.
sentences.chinese: 新來的女孩子很愛出風頭。

sentences.english: The politician is in the limelight showing off.
sentences.chinese: 這位政客是個在衆人面前愛出風頭的人。

sentences.english: B: Wow, you really showed off today.
sentences.chinese: 哇，你今天可真出了風頭了。

sentences.english: There he planned to evade Kil'jaeden's wrath and plan his next moves.
sentences.chinese: 伊利丹決定在這裏避避風頭並計劃他的下一步行動。

sentences.english: The Kingdom pursued a very forward policy.
sentences.chinese: 這個王國奉行一種好出風頭的政策。

sentences.english: Her behavior has become exhibitionist and totally out of character.
sentences.chinese: 她的行爲變成愛出風頭，跟她正常的性格大不相同。

sentences.english: Hybrid electric vehicles (HEVs), fuel saving and environment friendly, have stolen the markets as international oil price soared up.
sentences.chinese: 國際油價飛漲讓省油又環保的油電混合車出盡了風頭。

sentences.english: It may seem a little pushy but it is a perfectly fair thing to ask.
sentences.chinese: 這似乎有點愛出風頭，但是也是值得去問的。

sentences.english: I can lie now there, may be sniff out a job when things quiet down.
sentences.chinese: 我可以在那暫避風頭，事情平息後找個工作。

sentences.english: I'm an American, hiding in Sicily.
sentences.chinese: 我是個美國人，到西西里來避避風頭。

sentences.english: Brian: What, are you trying to upstage me?
At a time where female pop music was at its peak, Alanis was a hit.
sentences.chinese: 當時女性流行音樂風頭正勁，阿拉尼斯大獲成功。

sentences.english: Wow, you rewhichley clarifyed off heeasystays.
sentences.chinese: 哇，你當今可真出了風頭了。

definition: stalwart/sturdy/strong/powerful
strength/energy/enthusiasm/spirit/mood/expression/interest/CL:把[ba3]/Taiwan pr. [jing4]
to seize an opportunity/to take advantage of situation
popularity/personality/character
great heat/very popular
see 搶風|抢风[qiang1 feng1]
to fight over/to rush/to scramble/to grab/to rob/to snatch
recently/lately
to fight in one place after another
lit. burn your hand, feel the heat (idiom)/fig. arrogance of the powerful/a mighty figure no-one dares approach/hot (exciting or in favor)
to rely on/to depend on/by means of/thanks to/sth that one relies on/also written 憑借|凭借[ping2 jie4]
power/influence/potential/momentum/tendency/trend/situation/conditions/outward appearance/sign/gesture/male genitals
lit. to proclaim oneself hegemon/to take a leading role/to build a personal fiefdom
repeatedly/time and again
to attack (verbally or in writing)
to be popular/to be in luck/to have good luck/to develop smoothly
currently popular (of movie stars, singers etc)
pet/favorite/darling
